GapFillInput.Title: Continuous aspect
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type the correct words in the gaps. Use the verb in brackets and a continuous tense.

Content.Question:
1. What are you doing (do)?
I’m trying to make chicken liver stew.
2. Why are you crying?
Because I've just been watching (I/just/watch) a heartbreaking documentary.
3. The wedding went like clockwork, didn’t it?
Yes, they must have been planning (must/plan) it for ages.
4. They can't be working (can’t/work), today, can they?
Of course not: it’s Sunday! I bet they’re in the park.
5. Why were they so disappointed with Lorenzo’s Restaurant?
They had been expecting (expect) much better food.
6. Do the Barnes family still live there?
No, they haven't been living (live) there since 1998.
7. Why did you leave in the middle of your exam?
Because I was feeling (feel) sick.
8. Where are the prisoners?
For now they are being kept (keep) in a secure centre near the border.
9. What have you been doing (do) since I last saw you?
I’ve been travelling in Mexico, Ecuador and Peru.
10. Those kids won't be sleeping (sleep) here tonight, will they?
No, I think they’re being put up in a hotel.
